text: Lionel Edgar Cox (died 6 December 1945)Deaths. The Times (London, England), Saturday, Dec 08, 1945; pg. 1; Issue 50320 was an English cleric, Archdeacon of Madras from 1910 to 1922.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1929/30 p284: London, OUP, 19129 Cox was educated at Durham University and Dorchester Missionary College and was ordained in 1894. After a curacy in Kandy he served at Kalutara, Black Town, VeperyECCLESIASTICAL APPOINTMENTS . The Standard (London, England), Thursday, May 03, 1900; pg. 8; Issue 23666. and Bangalore.NLS He was also, from 1907 to 1918, Domestic Chaplain to Henry Whitehead, Bishop of Madras. From 1922 to 1929, Cox was rector of Lyndon, Rutland. ==References== Category:19th-century Anglican priests Category:20th- century Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Durham University Category:Alumni of Dorchester Missionary College Category:Archdeacons of Madras Category:1945 deaths Category:Year of birth missing
title: Lionel Cox (priest)
